channel.title: Dave Van Kesteren
channel.description: Recent news about Dave Van Kesteren, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Marketwire (press release)
item.description:
Harper Government Invests in Small Craft Harbours in Ontario
3, 2013) - Dave Van Kesteren, Member of Parliament for Chatham- Kent- Essex, on behalf of the Honourable Gail Shea, Minister of Fisheries and Oceans, today announced that as part of the Government of Canada investment of $1.6 million for small craft harbours in Ontario, work will be undertaken at Rondeau Harbour and Wheatley Harbour. "Investing in improvements at small craft harbours in Ontario will support the fishing industry, stimulate local economies and help promote tourism," said MP Van Kesteren.

item.title: Mentioned by CBC.ca
item.description:
Wheatley, Erieau harbours get federal funding for upgrades
Chatham-Kent-Essex MP Dave Van Kesteren made the announcement Tuesday morning. Maintenance dredging will be done at the Wheatley harbour. There will also be a study to find a long-term solution to low water levels there. In Erieau, the wharf will be ...

item.title: Mentioned by BlackburnNews.com
item.description:
Harbour Improvements Coming
MP for Chatham-Kent-Essex Dave Van Kesteren says these improvements show commercial fishermen their committment to the industry. “We've made some committments and some significant committments to the repair and the maintenance of the harbours.

item.title: Mentioned by Chatham Daily News
item.description:
Repairs long overdue, says marina owner
Chatham-Kent Essex MP Dave Van Kesteren announces federal funding for local harbour projects on Tuesday, Sept. 3, 2013. The wharf at Rondeau Harbour in Erieau will be repaired and there will be re-dredging at Wheatley Harbour. (Contributed photo).

item.title: Mentioned by Chatham Daily News
item.description:
Chatham-Kent Essex MP Dave Van Kesteren says Canada should stay out of ...
Dave Van Kesteren has a message for Prime Minister Stephen Harper – stay out of Syria. The MP for Chatham-Kent Essex said Canada has a role to play in the Syrian conflict but he is opposed to any military action in the war-torn country. Harper announced ...
